name: euthamia graminifolia
description: Grass-leaved Goldenrod is a rhizomatous, sometimes aggressive species and therefore may not be suitable for small landscape plantings. It will grow in dry to somewhat wet soils although it prefers full sun. This species is not a true goldenrod, and for that reason it is now classified in a different genus as Euthamia graminifolia.
features: Pollinator Favorite: butterflies, bees and birds
Deer Resistant (Our experiences here in the Upper Midwest may vary in other regions; deer can respond differently to local conditions or seasonal variations.)
